#!/bin/bash

# MCP Server Stop Script with Qdrant Integration
# Robust shutdown script with graceful termination, cleanup, and Qdrant management

set -e

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
PURPLE='\033[0;35m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
LOG_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/logs"
MCP_LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/mcp_server.log"
PID_FILE="$SCRIPT_DIR/mcp_server.pid"
SERVER_PORT=8766
HEALTH_ENDPOINT="http://localhost:$SERVER_PORT/health"

# Qdrant Configuration
QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME="qdrant_db"
QDRANT_PORT=6333
QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT="http://localhost:$QDRANT_PORT/collections"

# Function to log messages
log_message() {
    local level=$1
    local message=$2
    local timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    echo -e "${timestamp} [${level}] ${message}" | tee -a "$MCP_LOG_FILE"
}

# Function to check Docker availability
check_docker() {
    if ! command -v docker > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "WARN" "Docker not found. Qdrant management will be skipped."
        return 1
    fi
    
    if ! docker info > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "WARN" "Docker daemon not running. Qdrant management will be skipped."
        return 1
    fi
    
    return 0
}

# Function to check Qdrant container status
check_qdrant_container() {
    if ! check_docker; then
        return 1
    fi
    
    if docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is running"
        return 0
    elif docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container exists but is stopped"
        return 2
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container does not exist"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to stop Qdrant container
stop_qdrant_container() {
    if ! check_docker; then
        return 0
    fi
    
    if docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Stopping Qdrant container..."
        docker stop "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"
        
        # Wait for container to stop
        local max_attempts=10
        local attempt=0
        
        while [ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]; do
            if ! docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
                log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container stopped successfully"
                return 0
            fi
            
            attempt=$((attempt + 1))
            sleep 1
        done
        
        log_message "WARN" "Qdrant container stop timeout, forcing..."
        docker kill "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container force stopped"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is not running"
        return 0
    fi
}

# Function to check if server is running
check_server_running() {
    if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
        local pid=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
        if ps -p "$pid" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            return 0
        else
            log_message "WARN" "PID file exists but process not running"
            rm -f "$PID_FILE"
            return 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # Check if any process is using the port
    if netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep -q ":$SERVER_PORT "; then
        return 0
    fi
    
    return 1
}

# Function to get server PID
get_server_pid() {
    if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
        local pid=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
        if ps -p "$pid" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo "$pid"
            return 0
        fi
    fi
    
    # Try to find process by port
    local port_pid=$(netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep ":$SERVER_PORT " | awk '{print $7}' | cut -d'/' -f1 | head -1)
    if [ -n "$port_pid" ] && [ "$port_pid" != "-" ]; then
        echo "$port_pid"
        return 0
    fi
    
    return 1
}

# Function to graceful shutdown
graceful_shutdown() {
    local pid=$1
    local max_wait=30
    local wait_time=0
    
    log_message "INFO" "Attempting graceful shutdown of PID $pid"
    
    # Send SIGTERM
    kill -TERM "$pid" 2>/dev/null || {
        log_message "ERROR" "Failed to send SIGTERM to PID $pid"
        return 1
    }
    
    # Wait for graceful shutdown
    while [ $wait_time -lt $max_wait ]; do
        if ! ps -p "$pid" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            log_message "INFO" "Server stopped gracefully"
            return 0
        fi
        
        wait_time=$((wait_time + 1))
        sleep 1
    done
    
    log_message "WARN" "Graceful shutdown timeout, forcing termination"
    return 1
}

# Function to force shutdown
force_shutdown() {
    local pid=$1
    
    log_message "WARN" "Force killing PID $pid"
    kill -KILL "$pid" 2>/dev/null || {
        log_message "ERROR" "Failed to force kill PID $pid"
        return 1
    }
    
    # Wait a moment for process to die
    sleep 2
    
    if ! ps -p "$pid" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "INFO" "Server force stopped"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "ERROR" "Failed to stop server"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to cleanup
cleanup() {
    log_message "INFO" "Performing cleanup..."
    
    # Remove PID file
    if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
        log_message "INFO" "Removed PID file"
    fi
    
    # Check for any remaining processes on the port
    local remaining_pid=$(netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep ":$SERVER_PORT " | awk '{print $7}' | cut -d'/' -f1 | head -1)
    if [ -n "$remaining_pid" ] && [ "$remaining_pid" != "-" ]; then
        log_message "WARN" "Found remaining process on port: $remaining_pid"
        kill -KILL "$remaining_pid" 2>/dev/null || true
        log_message "INFO" "Killed remaining process"
    fi
}

# Function to display server status
display_server_status() {
    echo ""
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“Š MCP Server Status${NC}"
    echo "========================"
    
    if check_server_running; then
        local pid=$(get_server_pid)
        echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Server is running${NC}"
        echo -e "${CYAN}PID:${NC} $pid"
        echo -e "${CYAN}Port:${NC} $SERVER_PORT"
        
        # Test health endpoint
        if curl -s "$HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Health endpoint responding${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Health endpoint not responding${NC}"
        fi
    else
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Server is not running${NC}"
    fi
    
    echo ""
    
    # Display Qdrant status
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“Š Qdrant Status${NC}"
    echo "=================="
    if check_qdrant_container; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container is running${NC}"
        echo -e "${CYAN}Container:${NC} $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"
        echo -e "${CYAN}Port:${NC} $QDRANT_PORT"
        
        # Test Qdrant health
        if curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant health endpoint responding${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant health endpoint not responding${NC}"
        fi
    else
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Qdrant container is not running${NC}"
    fi
    
    echo ""
}

# Function to stop server
stop_server() {
    if ! check_server_running; then
        log_message "INFO" "Server is not running"
        return 0
    fi
    
    local pid=$(get_server_pid)
    if [ -z "$pid" ]; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Could not determine server PID"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log_message "INFO" "Stopping MCP server (PID: $pid)"
    
    # Try graceful shutdown first
    if graceful_shutdown "$pid"; then
        cleanup
        return 0
    fi
    
    # Force shutdown if graceful failed
    if force_shutdown "$pid"; then
        cleanup
        return 0
    fi
    
    log_message "ERROR" "Failed to stop server"
    return 1
}

# Function to display usage
display_usage() {
    echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
    echo ""
    echo "Options:"
    echo "  -h, --help     Show this help message"
    echo "  -s, --status   Show server status only"
    echo "  -f, --force    Force stop without graceful shutdown"
    echo "  -q, --qdrant   Stop Qdrant container only"
    echo ""
    echo "Examples:"
    echo "  $0              # Stop server and Qdrant gracefully"
    echo "  $0 --status     # Show server and Qdrant status"
    echo "  $0 --force      # Force stop server and Qdrant"
    echo "  $0 --qdrant     # Stop Qdrant container only"
}

# Main execution
main() {
    local show_status_only=false
    local force_stop=false
    local qdrant_only=false
    
    # Parse command line arguments
    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
        case $1 in
            -h|--help)
                display_usage
                exit 0
                ;;
            -s|--status)
                show_status_only=true
                shift
                ;;
            -f|--force)
                force_stop=true
                shift
                ;;
            -q|--qdrant)
                qdrant_only=true
                shift
                ;;
            *)
                echo -e "${RED}Unknown option: $1${NC}"
                display_usage
                exit 1
                ;;
        esac
    done
    
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ›‘ MCP Server Stop Script with Qdrant Integration${NC}"
    echo "====================================================="
    
    if [ "$show_status_only" = true ]; then
        display_server_status
        exit 0
    fi
    
    if [ "$qdrant_only" = true ]; then
        echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ›‘ Stopping Qdrant Container Only${NC}"
        echo "====================================="
        
        if stop_qdrant_container; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container stopped successfully${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${RED}âŒ Failed to stop Qdrant container${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Stop Qdrant container first
    if check_docker; then
        echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ›‘ Stopping Qdrant Container${NC}"
        echo "================================"
        
        if stop_qdrant_container; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container stopped${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container stop failed or not running${NC}"
        fi
        echo ""
    fi
    
    # Stop MCP server
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ›‘ Stopping MCP Server${NC}"
    echo "========================="
    
    if stop_server; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… MCP server stopped successfully${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… All services stopped successfully${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Failed to stop MCP server${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Run main function
main "$@"

input.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Qdrant Container Management Script - START
# Dedicated script for starting Qdrant vector database container

set -e

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
LOG_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/logs"
QDRANT_LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/qdrant.log"

# Qdrant Configuration
QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME="qdrant_db"
QDRANT_PORT=6333
QDRANT_GRPC_PORT=6334
QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT="http://localhost:$QDRANT_PORT/collections"
QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH="$PROJECT_ROOT/data/qdrant_storage"
QDRANT_IMAGE="qdrant/qdrant:latest"

# Function to log messages
log_message() {
    local level=$1
    local message=$2
    local timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    echo -e "${timestamp} [${level}] ${message}" | tee -a "$QDRANT_LOG_FILE"
}

# Function to check Docker availability
check_docker() {
    if ! command -v docker > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Docker not found. Please install Docker first."
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Docker not found${NC}"
        echo "Please install Docker: https://docs.docker.com/get-docker/"
        return 1
    fi
    
    if ! docker info > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Docker daemon not running. Please start Docker service."
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Docker daemon not running${NC}"
        echo "Please start Docker service: sudo systemctl start docker"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log_message "INFO" "Docker available for Qdrant management"
    return 0
}

# Function to check if Qdrant container exists
check_qdrant_container() {
    if docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is running"
        return 0
    elif docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container exists but is stopped"
        return 2
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container does not exist"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to pull latest Qdrant image
pull_qdrant_image() {
    log_message "INFO" "Pulling latest Qdrant image..."
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“¦ Pulling Qdrant image: $QDRANT_IMAGE${NC}"
    
    if docker pull "$QDRANT_IMAGE"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant image pulled successfully"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "ERROR" "Failed to pull Qdrant image"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to setup Qdrant storage
setup_qdrant_storage() {
    log_message "INFO" "Setting up Qdrant storage directory..."
    
    # Create storage directory if it doesn't exist
    mkdir -p "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH"
    
    # Set proper permissions
    chmod 755 "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH"
    
    log_message "INFO" "Qdrant storage directory ready: $QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH"
    return 0
}

# Function to check if ports are available
check_ports_available() {
    local ports_in_use=""
    
    # Check main Qdrant port
    if netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep -q ":$QDRANT_PORT "; then
        ports_in_use="$ports_in_use $QDRANT_PORT"
    fi
    
    # Check gRPC port
    if netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep -q ":$QDRANT_GRPC_PORT "; then
        ports_in_use="$ports_in_use $QDRANT_GRPC_PORT"
    fi
    
    if [ -n "$ports_in_use" ]; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Ports in use:$ports_in_use"
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Ports in use:$ports_in_use${NC}"
        echo "Please stop services using these ports or use different ports"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log_message "INFO" "Ports $QDRANT_PORT and $QDRANT_GRPC_PORT are available"
    return 0
}

# Function to create Qdrant container
create_qdrant_container() {
    log_message "INFO" "Creating new Qdrant container..."
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ³ Creating Qdrant container: $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME${NC}"
    
    # Run Qdrant container with proper configuration
    if docker run -d \
        --name "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" \
        --restart unless-stopped \
        -p "$QDRANT_PORT:6333" \
        -p "$QDRANT_GRPC_PORT:6334" \
        -v "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH:/qdrant/storage" \
        -e "QDRANT__SERVICE__HTTP_PORT=6333" \
        -e "QDRANT__SERVICE__GRPC_PORT=6334" \
        "$QDRANT_IMAGE"; then
        
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container created successfully"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "ERROR" "Failed to create Qdrant container"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to start existing Qdrant container
start_existing_container() {
    log_message "INFO" "Starting existing Qdrant container..."
    echo -e "${BLUE}â–¶ï¸  Starting existing Qdrant container${NC}"
    
    if docker start "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container started successfully"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "ERROR" "Failed to start existing Qdrant container"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to wait for Qdrant to be ready
wait_for_qdrant_ready() {
    local max_attempts=60
    local attempt=0
    
    log_message "INFO" "Waiting for Qdrant to be ready..."
    echo -e "${YELLOW}â³ Waiting for Qdrant to be ready...${NC}"
    
    while [ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]; do
        if curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            log_message "INFO" "Qdrant is ready and responding"
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant is ready${NC}"
            return 0
        fi
        
        # Show progress
        if [ $((attempt % 10)) -eq 0 ]; then
            echo -n "."
        fi
        
        attempt=$((attempt + 1))
        sleep 1
    done
    
    echo ""
    log_message "ERROR" "Qdrant failed to start within $max_attempts seconds"
    echo -e "${RED}âŒ Qdrant startup timeout${NC}"
    return 1
}

# Function to check Qdrant health
check_qdrant_health() {
    if curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant health check passed"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "WARN" "Qdrant health check failed"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to get Qdrant information
get_qdrant_info() {
    local info=""
    
    # Get collections
    if check_qdrant_health; then
        info=$(curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" 2>/dev/null | jq -r '.result.collections[].name' 2>/dev/null | tr '\n' ', ' | sed 's/,$//')
        if [ -z "$info" ]; then
            info="No collections"
        fi
    else
        info="Unable to retrieve"
    fi
    
    echo "$info"
}

# Function to display Qdrant status
display_qdrant_status() {
    echo ""
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant Vector Database Started Successfully${NC}"
    echo "=============================================="
    echo -e "${CYAN}Container Name:${NC} $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Image:${NC} $QDRANT_IMAGE"
    echo -e "${CYAN}HTTP Port:${NC} $QDRANT_PORT"
    echo -e "${CYAN}gRPC Port:${NC} $QDRANT_GRPC_PORT"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Storage Path:${NC} $QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Health Endpoint:${NC} $QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Collections:${NC} $(get_qdrant_info)"
    echo ""
    
    # Container details
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“Š Container Details:${NC}"
    docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}\t{{.Status}}\t{{.Ports}}" | grep "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" || echo "Container not found"
    echo ""
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Useful Commands:${NC}"
    echo -e "  Check health: ${BLUE}curl $QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT${NC}"
    echo -e "  View logs: ${BLUE}docker logs $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME${NC}"
    echo -e "  Stop Qdrant: ${BLUE}./stop_qdrant.sh${NC}"
    echo -e "  Connect to container: ${BLUE}docker exec -it $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME /bin/bash${NC}"
    echo ""
}

# Function to setup logging
setup_logging() {
    # Create logs directory if it doesn't exist
    mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"
    
    # Rotate log file if it's too large (>50MB)
    if [ -f "$QDRANT_LOG_FILE" ] && [ $(stat -c%s "$QDRANT_LOG_FILE") -gt 52428800 ]; then
        mv "$QDRANT_LOG_FILE" "${QDRANT_LOG_FILE}.$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)"
        log_message "INFO" "Rotated Qdrant log file"
    fi
}

# Function to display usage
display_usage() {
    echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
    echo ""
    echo "Options:"
    echo "  -h, --help     Show this help message"
    echo "  -p, --pull     Pull latest Qdrant image before starting"
    echo "  -f, --force    Force recreate container (removes existing)"
    echo "  -s, --status   Show Qdrant status only"
    echo ""
    echo "Examples:"
    echo "  $0              # Start Qdrant container"
    echo "  $0 --pull       # Pull latest image and start"
    echo "  $0 --force      # Force recreate container"
    echo "  $0 --status     # Show current status"
}

# Main execution
main() {
    local pull_image=false
    local force_recreate=false
    local show_status_only=false
    
    # Parse command line arguments
    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
        case $1 in
            -h|--help)
                display_usage
                exit 0
                ;;
            -p|--pull)
                pull_image=true
                shift
                ;;
            -f|--force)
                force_recreate=true
                shift
                ;;
            -s|--status)
                show_status_only=true
                shift
                ;;
            *)
                echo -e "${RED}Unknown option: $1${NC}"
                display_usage
                exit 1
                ;;
        esac
    done
    
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸš€ Starting Qdrant Vector Database${NC}"
    echo "======================================"
    
    # Setup logging
    setup_logging
    
    # Check Docker availability
    if ! check_docker; then
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Show status only if requested
    if [ "$show_status_only" = true ]; then
        local status=$(check_qdrant_container)
        case $status in
            0)
                echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant is running${NC}"
                display_qdrant_status
                ;;
            2)
                echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container exists but is stopped${NC}"
                ;;
            *)
                echo -e "${RED}âŒ Qdrant container does not exist${NC}"
                ;;
        esac
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Check if already running
    if check_qdrant_container; then
        case $? in
            0)
                echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant is already running${NC}"
                if [ "$force_recreate" = true ]; then
                    echo -e "${YELLOW}ğŸ”„ Force recreating container...${NC}"
                    docker stop "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
                    docker rm "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
                else
                    display_qdrant_status
                    exit 0
                fi
                ;;
            2)
                echo -e "${BLUE}â–¶ï¸  Qdrant container exists but is stopped${NC}"
                if [ "$force_recreate" = true ]; then
                    echo -e "${YELLOW}ğŸ”„ Force recreating container...${NC}"
                    docker rm "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
                fi
                ;;
        esac
    fi
    
    # Pull image if requested
    if [ "$pull_image" = true ]; then
        if ! pull_qdrant_image; then
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # Check port availability
    if ! check_ports_available; then
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Setup storage
    if ! setup_qdrant_storage; then
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Start or create container
    if [ "$force_recreate" = true ] || ! docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        # Create new container
        if ! create_qdrant_container; then
            exit 1
        fi
    else
        # Start existing container
        if ! start_existing_container; then
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # Wait for Qdrant to be ready
    if wait_for_qdrant_ready; then
        display_qdrant_status
    else
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Qdrant startup failed${NC}"
        echo "Check logs: docker logs $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Run main function
main "$@"

#!/bin/bash

# Qdrant Container Management Script - START
# Dedicated script for starting Qdrant vector database container

set -e

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
LOG_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/logs"
QDRANT_LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/qdrant.log"

# Qdrant Configuration
QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME="qdrant_db"
QDRANT_PORT=6333
QDRANT_GRPC_PORT=6334
QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT="http://localhost:$QDRANT_PORT/collections"
QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH="$PROJECT_ROOT/data/qdrant_storage"
QDRANT_IMAGE="qdrant/qdrant:latest"

# Function to log messages
log_message() {
    local level=$1
    local message=$2
    local timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    echo -e "${timestamp} [${level}] ${message}" | tee -a "$QDRANT_LOG_FILE"
}

# Function to check Docker availability
check_docker() {
    if ! command -v docker > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Docker not found. Please install Docker first."
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Docker not found${NC}"
        echo "Please install Docker: https://docs.docker.com/get-docker/"
        return 1
    fi
    
    if ! docker info > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Docker daemon not running. Please start Docker service."
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Docker daemon not running${NC}"
        echo "Please start Docker service: sudo systemctl start docker"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log_message "INFO" "Docker available for Qdrant management"
    return 0
}

# Function to check if Qdrant container exists
check_qdrant_container() {
    if docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is running"
        return 0
    elif docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container exists but is stopped"
        return 2
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container does not exist"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to pull latest Qdrant image
pull_qdrant_image() {
    log_message "INFO" "Pulling latest Qdrant image..."
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“¦ Pulling Qdrant image: $QDRANT_IMAGE${NC}"
    
    if docker pull "$QDRANT_IMAGE"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant image pulled successfully"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "ERROR" "Failed to pull Qdrant image"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to setup Qdrant storage
setup_qdrant_storage() {
    log_message "INFO" "Setting up Qdrant storage directory..."
    
    # Create storage directory if it doesn't exist
    mkdir -p "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH"
    
    # Set proper permissions
    chmod 755 "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH"
    
    log_message "INFO" "Qdrant storage directory ready: $QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH"
    return 0
}

# Function to check if ports are available
check_ports_available() {
    local ports_in_use=""
    
    # Check main Qdrant port
    if netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep -q ":$QDRANT_PORT "; then
        ports_in_use="$ports_in_use $QDRANT_PORT"
    fi
    
    # Check gRPC port
    if netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep -q ":$QDRANT_GRPC_PORT "; then
        ports_in_use="$ports_in_use $QDRANT_GRPC_PORT"
    fi
    
    if [ -n "$ports_in_use" ]; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Ports in use:$ports_in_use"
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Ports in use:$ports_in_use${NC}"
        echo "Please stop services using these ports or use different ports"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log_message "INFO" "Ports $QDRANT_PORT and $QDRANT_GRPC_PORT are available"
    return 0
}

# Function to create Qdrant container
create_qdrant_container() {
    log_message "INFO" "Creating new Qdrant container..."
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ³ Creating Qdrant container: $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME${NC}"
    
    # Run Qdrant container with proper configuration
    if docker run -d \
        --name "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" \
        --restart unless-stopped \
        -p "$QDRANT_PORT:6333" \
        -p "$QDRANT_GRPC_PORT:6334" \
        -v "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH:/qdrant/storage" \
        -e "QDRANT__SERVICE__HTTP_PORT=6333" \
        -e "QDRANT__SERVICE__GRPC_PORT=6334" \
        "$QDRANT_IMAGE"; then
        
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container created successfully"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "ERROR" "Failed to create Qdrant container"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to start existing Qdrant container
start_existing_container() {
    log_message "INFO" "Starting existing Qdrant container..."
    echo -e "${BLUE}â–¶ï¸  Starting existing Qdrant container${NC}"
    
    if docker start "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container started successfully"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "ERROR" "Failed to start existing Qdrant container"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to wait for Qdrant to be ready
wait_for_qdrant_ready() {
    local max_attempts=60
    local attempt=0
    
    log_message "INFO" "Waiting for Qdrant to be ready..."
    echo -e "${YELLOW}â³ Waiting for Qdrant to be ready...${NC}"
    
    while [ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]; do
        if curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            log_message "INFO" "Qdrant is ready and responding"
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant is ready${NC}"
            return 0
        fi
        
        # Show progress
        if [ $((attempt % 10)) -eq 0 ]; then
            echo -n "."
        fi
        
        attempt=$((attempt + 1))
        sleep 1
    done
    
    echo ""
    log_message "ERROR" "Qdrant failed to start within $max_attempts seconds"
    echo -e "${RED}âŒ Qdrant startup timeout${NC}"
    return 1
}

# Function to check Qdrant health
check_qdrant_health() {
    if curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant health check passed"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "WARN" "Qdrant health check failed"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to get Qdrant information
get_qdrant_info() {
    local info=""
    
    # Get collections
    if check_qdrant_health; then
        info=$(curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" 2>/dev/null | jq -r '.result.collections[].name' 2>/dev/null | tr '\n' ', ' | sed 's/,$//')
        if [ -z "$info" ]; then
            info="No collections"
        fi
    else
        info="Unable to retrieve"
    fi
    
    echo "$info"
}

# Function to display Qdrant status
display_qdrant_status() {
    echo ""
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant Vector Database Started Successfully${NC}"
    echo "=============================================="
    echo -e "${CYAN}Container Name:${NC} $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Image:${NC} $QDRANT_IMAGE"
    echo -e "${CYAN}HTTP Port:${NC} $QDRANT_PORT"
    echo -e "${CYAN}gRPC Port:${NC} $QDRANT_GRPC_PORT"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Storage Path:${NC} $QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Health Endpoint:${NC} $QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Collections:${NC} $(get_qdrant_info)"
    echo ""
    
    # Container details
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“Š Container Details:${NC}"
    docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}\t{{.Status}}\t{{.Ports}}" | grep "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" || echo "Container not found"
    echo ""
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Useful Commands:${NC}"
    echo -e "  Check health: ${BLUE}curl $QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT${NC}"
    echo -e "  View logs: ${BLUE}docker logs $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME${NC}"
    echo -e "  Stop Qdrant: ${BLUE}./stop_qdrant.sh${NC}"
    echo -e "  Connect to container: ${BLUE}docker exec -it $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME /bin/bash${NC}"
    echo ""
}

# Function to setup logging
setup_logging() {
    # Create logs directory if it doesn't exist
    mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"
    
    # Rotate log file if it's too large (>50MB)
    if [ -f "$QDRANT_LOG_FILE" ] && [ $(stat -c%s "$QDRANT_LOG_FILE") -gt 52428800 ]; then
        mv "$QDRANT_LOG_FILE" "${QDRANT_LOG_FILE}.$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)"
        log_message "INFO" "Rotated Qdrant log file"
    fi
}

# Function to display usage
display_usage() {
    echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
    echo ""
    echo "Options:"
    echo "  -h, --help     Show this help message"
    echo "  -p, --pull     Pull latest Qdrant image before starting"
    echo "  -f, --force    Force recreate container (removes existing)"
    echo "  -s, --status   Show Qdrant status only"
    echo ""
    echo "Examples:"
    echo "  $0              # Start Qdrant container"
    echo "  $0 --pull       # Pull latest image and start"
    echo "  $0 --force      # Force recreate container"
    echo "  $0 --status     # Show current status"
}

# Main execution
main() {
    local pull_image=false
    local force_recreate=false
    local show_status_only=false
    
    # Parse command line arguments
    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
        case $1 in
            -h|--help)
                display_usage
                exit 0
                ;;
            -p|--pull)
                pull_image=true
                shift
                ;;
            -f|--force)
                force_recreate=true
                shift
                ;;
            -s|--status)
                show_status_only=true
                shift
                ;;
            *)
                echo -e "${RED}Unknown option: $1${NC}"
                display_usage
                exit 1
                ;;
        esac
    done
    
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸš€ Starting Qdrant Vector Database${NC}"
    echo "======================================"
    
    # Setup logging
    setup_logging
    
    # Check Docker availability
    if ! check_docker; then
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Show status only if requested
    if [ "$show_status_only" = true ]; then
        local status=$(check_qdrant_container)
        case $status in
            0)
                echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant is running${NC}"
                display_qdrant_status
                ;;
            2)
                echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container exists but is stopped${NC}"
                ;;
            *)
                echo -e "${RED}âŒ Qdrant container does not exist${NC}"
                ;;
        esac
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Check if already running
    if check_qdrant_container; then
        case $? in
            0)
                echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant is already running${NC}"
                if [ "$force_recreate" = true ]; then
                    echo -e "${YELLOW}ğŸ”„ Force recreating container...${NC}"
                    docker stop "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
                    docker rm "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
                else
                    display_qdrant_status
                    exit 0
                fi
                ;;
            2)
                echo -e "${BLUE}â–¶ï¸  Qdrant container exists but is stopped${NC}"
                if [ "$force_recreate" = true ]; then
                    echo -e "${YELLOW}ğŸ”„ Force recreating container...${NC}"
                    docker rm "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
                fi
                ;;
        esac
    fi
    
    # Pull image if requested
    if [ "$pull_image" = true ]; then
        if ! pull_qdrant_image; then
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # Check port availability
    if ! check_ports_available; then
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Setup storage
    if ! setup_qdrant_storage; then
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Start or create container
    if [ "$force_recreate" = true ] || ! docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        # Create new container
        if ! create_qdrant_container; then
            exit 1
        fi
    else
        # Start existing container
        if ! start_existing_container; then
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # Wait for Qdrant to be ready
    if wait_for_qdrant_ready; then
        display_qdrant_status
    else
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Qdrant startup failed${NC}"
        echo "Check logs: docker logs $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Run main function
main "$@"

#!/bin/bash

# Qdrant Container Management Script - STOP
# Dedicated script for stopping Qdrant vector database container

set -e

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
LOG_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/logs"
QDRANT_LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/qdrant.log"

# Qdrant Configuration
QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME="qdrant_db"
QDRANT_PORT=6333
QDRANT_GRPC_PORT=6334
QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT="http://localhost:$QDRANT_PORT/collections"
QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH="$PROJECT_ROOT/data/qdrant_storage"

# Function to log messages
log_message() {
    local level=$1
    local message=$2
    local timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    echo -e "${timestamp} [${level}] ${message}" | tee -a "$QDRANT_LOG_FILE"
}

# Function to check Docker availability
check_docker() {
    if ! command -v docker > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "WARN" "Docker not found. Cannot manage Qdrant container."
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Docker not found${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
    
    if ! docker info > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "WARN" "Docker daemon not running. Cannot manage Qdrant container."
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Docker daemon not running${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
    
    return 0
}

# Function to check Qdrant container status
check_qdrant_container() {
    if docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is running"
        return 0
    elif docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container exists but is stopped"
        return 2
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container does not exist"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to get container info
get_container_info() {
    if docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}\t{{.Status}}\t{{.Ports}}" | grep "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"; then
        return 0
    else
        echo "Container not found"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to stop Qdrant container gracefully
stop_qdrant_container() {
    if ! check_docker; then
        return 1
    fi
    
    local container_status=$(check_qdrant_container)
    case $container_status in
        0)
            log_message "INFO" "Stopping Qdrant container gracefully..."
            echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ›‘ Stopping Qdrant container gracefully...${NC}"
            
            if docker stop "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"; then
                log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container stopped successfully"
                return 0
            else
                log_message "ERROR" "Failed to stop Qdrant container"
                return 1
            fi
            ;;
        2)
            log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is already stopped"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container is already stopped${NC}"
            return 0
            ;;
        *)
            log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container does not exist"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container does not exist${NC}"
            return 0
            ;;
    esac
}

# Function to force stop Qdrant container
force_stop_qdrant_container() {
    if ! check_docker; then
        return 1
    fi
    
    if docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "WARN" "Force stopping Qdrant container..."
        echo -e "${YELLOW}âš¡ Force stopping Qdrant container...${NC}"
        
        if docker kill "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"; then
            log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container force stopped"
            return 0
        else
            log_message "ERROR" "Failed to force stop Qdrant container"
            return 1
        fi
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is not running"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container is not running${NC}"
        return 0
    fi
}

# Function to remove Qdrant container
remove_qdrant_container() {
    if ! check_docker; then
        return 1
    fi
    
    if docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Removing Qdrant container..."
        echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ—‘ï¸  Removing Qdrant container...${NC}"
        
        # Stop first if running
        docker stop "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
        
        if docker rm "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"; then
            log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container removed successfully"
            return 0
        else
            log_message "ERROR" "Failed to remove Qdrant container"
            return 1
        fi
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container does not exist"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container does not exist${NC}"
        return 0
    fi
}

# Function to check data persistence
check_data_persistence() {
    echo -e "${CYAN}ğŸ“Š Data Persistence Status:${NC}"
    if [ -d "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH" ]; then
        local size=$(du -sh "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH" 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)
        local files=$(find "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH" -type f 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        echo -e "  ${GREEN}âœ… Storage directory exists${NC}"
        echo -e "  ${CYAN}Path:${NC} $QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH"
        echo -e "  ${CYAN}Size:${NC} $size"
        echo -e "  ${CYAN}Files:${NC} $files"
        
        if [ "$files" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo -e "  ${GREEN}âœ… Data appears to be preserved${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "  ${YELLOW}âš ï¸  No data files found${NC}"
        fi
    else
        echo -e "  ${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Storage directory not found${NC}"
    fi
}

# Function to display Qdrant status
display_qdrant_status() {
    echo ""
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“Š Qdrant Status${NC}"
    echo "=================="
    
    local container_status=$(check_qdrant_container)
    case $container_status in
        0)
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container is running${NC}"
            echo -e "${CYAN}Container Details:${NC}"
            get_container_info
            
            # Test health endpoint
            if curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Health endpoint responding${NC}"
                
                # Get collections info
                local collections=$(curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" 2>/dev/null | jq -r '.result.collections[].name' 2>/dev/null | tr '\n' ', ' | sed 's/,$//')
                if [ -n "$collections" ]; then
                    echo -e "${CYAN}Collections:${NC} $collections"
                else
                    echo -e "${CYAN}Collections:${NC} No collections"
                fi
            else
                echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Health endpoint not responding${NC}"
            fi
            ;;
        2)
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container exists but is stopped${NC}"
            echo -e "${CYAN}Container Details:${NC}"
            get_container_info
            ;;
        *)
            echo -e "${RED}âŒ Qdrant container does not exist${NC}"
            ;;
    esac
    
    echo ""
    check_data_persistence
    echo ""
}

# Function to cleanup ports
cleanup_ports() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ§¹ Checking port cleanup...${NC}"
    
    local ports_to_check=("$QDRANT_PORT" "$QDRANT_GRPC_PORT")
    local cleaned_ports=""
    
    for port in "${ports_to_check[@]}"; do
        if netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep -q ":$port "; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Port $port still in use${NC}"
            
            # Try to find the process using the port
            local pid=$(netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep ":$port " | awk '{print $7}' | cut -d'/' -f1 | head -1)
            if [ -n "$pid" ] && [ "$pid" != "-" ]; then
                echo -e "${CYAN}Process using port $port: PID $pid${NC}"
            fi
        else
            cleaned_ports="$cleaned_ports $port"
        fi
    done
    
    if [ -n "$cleaned_ports" ]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Ports freed:$cleaned_ports${NC}"
    fi
}

# Function to display usage
display_usage() {
    echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
    echo ""
    echo "Options:"
    echo "  -h, --help     Show this help message"
    echo "  -s, --status   Show Qdrant status only"
    echo "  -f, --force    Force stop without graceful shutdown"
    echo "  -r, --remove   Remove container completely (keeps data)"
    echo "  -c, --cleanup  Clean up ports and processes"
    echo ""
    echo "Examples:"
    echo "  $0              # Stop Qdrant container gracefully"
    echo "  $0 --status     # Show current status"
    echo "  $0 --force      # Force stop container"
    echo "  $0 --remove     # Remove container (data preserved)"
    echo "  $0 --cleanup    # Clean up ports"
}

# Function to setup logging
setup_logging() {
    # Create logs directory if it doesn't exist
    mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"
}

# Main execution
main() {
    local show_status_only=false
    local force_stop=false
    local remove_container=false
    local cleanup_only=false
    
    # Parse command line arguments
    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
        case $1 in
            -h|--help)
                display_usage
                exit 0
                ;;
            -s|--status)
                show_status_only=true
                shift
                ;;
            -f|--force)
                force_stop=true
                shift
                ;;
            -r|--remove)
                remove_container=true
                shift
                ;;
            -c|--cleanup)
                cleanup_only=true
                shift
                ;;
            *)
                echo -e "${RED}Unknown option: $1${NC}"
                display_usage
                exit 1
                ;;
        esac
    done
    
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ›‘ Stopping Qdrant Vector Database${NC}"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Setup logging
    setup_logging
    
    # Check Docker availability
    if ! check_docker; then
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Show status only if requested
    if [ "$show_status_only" = true ]; then
        display_qdrant_status
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Cleanup only if requested
    if [ "$cleanup_only" = true ]; then
        cleanup_ports
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Remove container if requested
    if [ "$remove_container" = true ]; then
        if remove_qdrant_container; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container removed successfully${NC}"
            check_data_persistence
            cleanup_ports
        else
            echo -e "${RED}âŒ Failed to remove Qdrant container${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Stop container
    if [ "$force_stop" = true ]; then
        if force_stop_qdrant_container; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container force stopped${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${RED}âŒ Failed to force stop Qdrant container${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
    else
        if stop_qdrant_container; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container stopped gracefully${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${RED}âŒ Failed to stop Qdrant container${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # Cleanup ports
    cleanup_ports
    
    echo ""
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant shutdown complete${NC}"
    echo ""
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Data Preservation:${NC}"
    echo -e "  Your data is preserved in: ${CYAN}$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH${NC}"
    echo -e "  To start again: ${BLUE}./start_qdrant.sh${NC}"
}

# Run main function
main "$@"

#!/bin/bash

# Qdrant Container Management Script - STOP
# Dedicated script for stopping Qdrant vector database container

set -e

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
LOG_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/logs"
QDRANT_LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/qdrant.log"

# Qdrant Configuration
QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME="qdrant_db"
QDRANT_PORT=6333
QDRANT_GRPC_PORT=6334
QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT="http://localhost:$QDRANT_PORT/collections"
QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH="$PROJECT_ROOT/data/qdrant_storage"

# Function to log messages
log_message() {
    local level=$1
    local message=$2
    local timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    echo -e "${timestamp} [${level}] ${message}" | tee -a "$QDRANT_LOG_FILE"
}

# Function to check Docker availability
check_docker() {
    if ! command -v docker > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "WARN" "Docker not found. Cannot manage Qdrant container."
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Docker not found${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
    
    if ! docker info > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "WARN" "Docker daemon not running. Cannot manage Qdrant container."
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Docker daemon not running${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
    
    return 0
}

# Function to check Qdrant container status
check_qdrant_container() {
    if docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is running"
        return 0
    elif docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container exists but is stopped"
        return 2
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container does not exist"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to get container info
get_container_info() {
    if docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}\t{{.Status}}\t{{.Ports}}" | grep "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"; then
        return 0
    else
        echo "Container not found"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to stop Qdrant container gracefully
stop_qdrant_container() {
    if ! check_docker; then
        return 1
    fi
    
    local container_status=$(check_qdrant_container)
    case $container_status in
        0)
            log_message "INFO" "Stopping Qdrant container gracefully..."
            echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ›‘ Stopping Qdrant container gracefully...${NC}"
            
            if docker stop "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"; then
                log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container stopped successfully"
                return 0
            else
                log_message "ERROR" "Failed to stop Qdrant container"
                return 1
            fi
            ;;
        2)
            log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is already stopped"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container is already stopped${NC}"
            return 0
            ;;
        *)
            log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container does not exist"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container does not exist${NC}"
            return 0
            ;;
    esac
}

# Function to force stop Qdrant container
force_stop_qdrant_container() {
    if ! check_docker; then
        return 1
    fi
    
    if docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "WARN" "Force stopping Qdrant container..."
        echo -e "${YELLOW}âš¡ Force stopping Qdrant container...${NC}"
        
        if docker kill "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"; then
            log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container force stopped"
            return 0
        else
            log_message "ERROR" "Failed to force stop Qdrant container"
            return 1
        fi
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is not running"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container is not running${NC}"
        return 0
    fi
}

# Function to remove Qdrant container
remove_qdrant_container() {
    if ! check_docker; then
        return 1
    fi
    
    if docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Removing Qdrant container..."
        echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ—‘ï¸  Removing Qdrant container...${NC}"
        
        # Stop first if running
        docker stop "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
        
        if docker rm "$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"; then
            log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container removed successfully"
            return 0
        else
            log_message "ERROR" "Failed to remove Qdrant container"
            return 1
        fi
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container does not exist"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container does not exist${NC}"
        return 0
    fi
}

# Function to check data persistence
check_data_persistence() {
    echo -e "${CYAN}ğŸ“Š Data Persistence Status:${NC}"
    if [ -d "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH" ]; then
        local size=$(du -sh "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH" 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)
        local files=$(find "$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH" -type f 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        echo -e "  ${GREEN}âœ… Storage directory exists${NC}"
        echo -e "  ${CYAN}Path:${NC} $QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH"
        echo -e "  ${CYAN}Size:${NC} $size"
        echo -e "  ${CYAN}Files:${NC} $files"
        
        if [ "$files" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo -e "  ${GREEN}âœ… Data appears to be preserved${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "  ${YELLOW}âš ï¸  No data files found${NC}"
        fi
    else
        echo -e "  ${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Storage directory not found${NC}"
    fi
}

# Function to display Qdrant status
display_qdrant_status() {
    echo ""
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“Š Qdrant Status${NC}"
    echo "=================="
    
    local container_status=$(check_qdrant_container)
    case $container_status in
        0)
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container is running${NC}"
            echo -e "${CYAN}Container Details:${NC}"
            get_container_info
            
            # Test health endpoint
            if curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Health endpoint responding${NC}"
                
                # Get collections info
                local collections=$(curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" 2>/dev/null | jq -r '.result.collections[].name' 2>/dev/null | tr '\n' ', ' | sed 's/,$//')
                if [ -n "$collections" ]; then
                    echo -e "${CYAN}Collections:${NC} $collections"
                else
                    echo -e "${CYAN}Collections:${NC} No collections"
                fi
            else
                echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Health endpoint not responding${NC}"
            fi
            ;;
        2)
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container exists but is stopped${NC}"
            echo -e "${CYAN}Container Details:${NC}"
            get_container_info
            ;;
        *)
            echo -e "${RED}âŒ Qdrant container does not exist${NC}"
            ;;
    esac
    
    echo ""
    check_data_persistence
    echo ""
}

# Function to cleanup ports
cleanup_ports() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ§¹ Checking port cleanup...${NC}"
    
    local ports_to_check=("$QDRANT_PORT" "$QDRANT_GRPC_PORT")
    local cleaned_ports=""
    
    for port in "${ports_to_check[@]}"; do
        if netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep -q ":$port "; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Port $port still in use${NC}"
            
            # Try to find the process using the port
            local pid=$(netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep ":$port " | awk '{print $7}' | cut -d'/' -f1 | head -1)
            if [ -n "$pid" ] && [ "$pid" != "-" ]; then
                echo -e "${CYAN}Process using port $port: PID $pid${NC}"
            fi
        else
            cleaned_ports="$cleaned_ports $port"
        fi
    done
    
    if [ -n "$cleaned_ports" ]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Ports freed:$cleaned_ports${NC}"
    fi
}

# Function to display usage
display_usage() {
    echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
    echo ""
    echo "Options:"
    echo "  -h, --help     Show this help message"
    echo "  -s, --status   Show Qdrant status only"
    echo "  -f, --force    Force stop without graceful shutdown"
    echo "  -r, --remove   Remove container completely (keeps data)"
    echo "  -c, --cleanup  Clean up ports and processes"
    echo ""
    echo "Examples:"
    echo "  $0              # Stop Qdrant container gracefully"
    echo "  $0 --status     # Show current status"
    echo "  $0 --force      # Force stop container"
    echo "  $0 --remove     # Remove container (data preserved)"
    echo "  $0 --cleanup    # Clean up ports"
}

# Function to setup logging
setup_logging() {
    # Create logs directory if it doesn't exist
    mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"
}

# Main execution
main() {
    local show_status_only=false
    local force_stop=false
    local remove_container=false
    local cleanup_only=false
    
    # Parse command line arguments
    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
        case $1 in
            -h|--help)
                display_usage
                exit 0
                ;;
            -s|--status)
                show_status_only=true
                shift
                ;;
            -f|--force)
                force_stop=true
                shift
                ;;
            -r|--remove)
                remove_container=true
                shift
                ;;
            -c|--cleanup)
                cleanup_only=true
                shift
                ;;
            *)
                echo -e "${RED}Unknown option: $1${NC}"
                display_usage
                exit 1
                ;;
        esac
    done
    
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ›‘ Stopping Qdrant Vector Database${NC}"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Setup logging
    setup_logging
    
    # Check Docker availability
    if ! check_docker; then
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Show status only if requested
    if [ "$show_status_only" = true ]; then
        display_qdrant_status
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Cleanup only if requested
    if [ "$cleanup_only" = true ]; then
        cleanup_ports
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Remove container if requested
    if [ "$remove_container" = true ]; then
        if remove_qdrant_container; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container removed successfully${NC}"
            check_data_persistence
            cleanup_ports
        else
            echo -e "${RED}âŒ Failed to remove Qdrant container${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Stop container
    if [ "$force_stop" = true ]; then
        if force_stop_qdrant_container; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container force stopped${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${RED}âŒ Failed to force stop Qdrant container${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
    else
        if stop_qdrant_container; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant container stopped gracefully${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${RED}âŒ Failed to stop Qdrant container${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # Cleanup ports
    cleanup_ports
    
    echo ""
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant shutdown complete${NC}"
    echo ""
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Data Preservation:${NC}"
    echo -e "  Your data is preserved in: ${CYAN}$QDRANT_STORAGE_PATH${NC}"
    echo -e "  To start again: ${BLUE}./start_qdrant.sh${NC}"
}

# Run main function
main "$@"

input.content:
#!/bin/bash

# MCP Server Start Script - MCP ONLY
# Dedicated script for starting MCP server with Qdrant dependency check

set -e

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
PURPLE='\033[0;35m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
VENV_PATH="$PROJECT_ROOT/.venv"
LOG_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/logs"
MCP_LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/mcp_server.log"
PID_FILE="$SCRIPT_DIR/mcp_server.pid"
SERVER_PORT=8766
HEALTH_ENDPOINT="http://localhost:$SERVER_PORT/health"

# Qdrant Configuration (for dependency check)
QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME="qdrant_db"
QDRANT_PORT=6333
QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT="http://localhost:$QDRANT_PORT/collections"

# Default server type
SERVER_TYPE=${1:-"unified"}
SERVER_SCRIPT=""

# Function to log messages
log_message() {
    local level=$1
    local message=$2
    local timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    echo -e "${timestamp} [${level}] ${message}" | tee -a "$MCP_LOG_FILE"
}

# Function to check Docker availability
check_docker() {
    if ! command -v docker > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "WARN" "Docker not found. Qdrant dependency check will be skipped."
        return 1
    fi
    
    if ! docker info > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "WARN" "Docker daemon not running. Qdrant dependency check will be skipped."
        return 1
    fi
    
    return 0
}

# Function to check Qdrant container status
check_qdrant_container() {
    if ! check_docker; then
        return 1
    fi
    
    if docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container is running"
        return 0
    elif docker ps -a --format "table {{.Names}}" | grep -q "^$QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME$"; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container exists but is stopped"
        return 2
    else
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant container does not exist"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to check Qdrant health
check_qdrant_health() {
    if curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "INFO" "Qdrant health check passed"
        return 0
    else
        log_message "WARN" "Qdrant health check failed"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to display Qdrant dependency status
display_qdrant_dependency_status() {
    echo -e "${CYAN}ğŸ“Š Qdrant Dependency Status:${NC}"
    
    if ! check_docker; then
        echo -e "  ${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Docker not available - Qdrant management disabled${NC}"
        echo -e "  ${CYAN}Impact:${NC} MCP will use in-memory storage"
        return 1
    fi
    
    local container_status=$(check_qdrant_container)
    case $container_status in
        0)
            if check_qdrant_health; then
                echo -e "  ${GREEN}âœ… Qdrant is running and healthy${NC}"
                echo -e "  ${CYAN}Container:${NC} $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME"
                echo -e "  ${CYAN}Port:${NC} $QDRANT_PORT"
                
                # Get collections info
                local collections=$(curl -s "$QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT" 2>/dev/null | jq -r '.result.collections[].name' 2>/dev/null | tr '\n' ', ' | sed 's/,$//')
                if [ -n "$collections" ]; then
                    echo -e "  ${CYAN}Collections:${NC} $collections"
                else
                    echo -e "  ${CYAN}Collections:${NC} No collections"
                fi
                return 0
            else
                echo -e "  ${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container running but not responding${NC}"
                echo -e "  ${CYAN}Impact:${NC} MCP will fall back to in-memory storage"
                return 1
            fi
            ;;
        2)
            echo -e "  ${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant container exists but is stopped${NC}"
            echo -e "  ${CYAN}Container:${NC} $QDRANT_CONTAINER_NAME (stopped)"
            echo -e "  ${CYAN}To start:${NC} ./start_qdrant.sh"
            echo -e "  ${CYAN}Impact:${NC} MCP will use in-memory storage"
            return 1
            ;;
        *)
            echo -e "  ${RED}âŒ Qdrant container does not exist${NC}"
            echo -e "  ${CYAN}To create:${NC} ./start_qdrant.sh"
            echo -e "  ${CYAN}Impact:${NC} MCP will use in-memory storage"
            return 1
            ;;
    esac
}

# Function to check if MCP server is already running
check_server_running() {
    if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
        local pid=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
        if ps -p "$pid" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            log_message "INFO" "MCP server already running with PID $pid"
            return 0
        else
            log_message "WARN" "Stale PID file found, removing"
            rm -f "$PID_FILE"
        fi
    fi
    return 1
}

# Function to check port availability
check_port_available() {
    if netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep -q ":$SERVER_PORT "; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Port $SERVER_PORT is already in use"
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Port $SERVER_PORT is already in use${NC}"
        
        # Try to find the process using the port
        local pid=$(netstat -tuln 2>/dev/null | grep ":$SERVER_PORT " | awk '{print $7}' | cut -d'/' -f1 | head -1)
        if [ -n "$pid" ] && [ "$pid" != "-" ]; then
            echo -e "${CYAN}Process using port: PID $pid${NC}"
        fi
        return 1
    fi
    return 0
}

# Function to activate virtual environment
activate_venv() {
    log_message "INFO" "Activating virtual environment..."
    if [ ! -d "$VENV_PATH" ]; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Virtual environment not found at $VENV_PATH"
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Virtual environment not found${NC}"
        echo -e "${CYAN}Create it with:${NC} python -m venv $VENV_PATH"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    source "$VENV_PATH/bin/activate"
    log_message "INFO" "Virtual environment activated: $(which python)"
}

# Function to check dependencies
check_dependencies() {
    log_message "INFO" "Checking dependencies..."
    
    # Check Python
    if ! python --version > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Python not found"
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Python not found${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Check required packages
    local required_packages=("fastapi" "uvicorn" "llama_cpp" "sentence_transformers" "qdrant_client")
    local missing_packages=()
    
    for package in "${required_packages[@]}"; do
        if ! python -c "import $package" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            missing_packages+=("$package")
        fi
    done
    
    if [ ${#missing_packages[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Missing required packages: ${missing_packages[*]}"
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Missing packages: ${missing_packages[*]}${NC}"
        echo -e "${CYAN}Install with:${NC} pip install ${missing_packages[*]}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    log_message "INFO" "All dependencies satisfied"
}

# Function to setup logging
setup_logging() {
    log_message "INFO" "Setting up logging..."
    
    # Create logs directory if it doesn't exist
    mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"
    
    # Rotate log file if it's too large (>100MB)
    if [ -f "$MCP_LOG_FILE" ] && [ $(stat -c%s "$MCP_LOG_FILE") -gt 104857600 ]; then
        mv "$MCP_LOG_FILE" "${MCP_LOG_FILE}.$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)"
        log_message "INFO" "Rotated log file"
    fi
}

# Function to determine server script
determine_server_script() {
    case $SERVER_TYPE in
        "simple"|"basic")
            SERVER_SCRIPT="simple_mcp_server.py"
            ;;
        "high"|"performance"|"enhanced")
            SERVER_SCRIPT="high_performance_mcp.py"
            ;;
        "unified"|"combined"|"main")
            SERVER_SCRIPT="unified_mcp_server.py"
            ;;
        *)
            log_message "ERROR" "Unknown server type: $SERVER_TYPE"
            echo -e "${RED}âŒ Unknown server type: $SERVER_TYPE${NC}"
            echo -e "${CYAN}Available types:${NC} simple, high, unified"
            exit 1
            ;;
    esac
    
    if [ ! -f "$SERVER_SCRIPT" ]; then
        log_message "ERROR" "Server script not found: $SERVER_SCRIPT"
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Server script not found: $SERVER_SCRIPT${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    log_message "INFO" "Using server script: $SERVER_SCRIPT"
}

# Function to start the MCP server
start_server() {
    log_message "INFO" "Starting MCP server..."
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸš€ Starting MCP server...${NC}"
    
    # Start server in background
    nohup python "$SERVER_SCRIPT" > "$MCP_LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
    local server_pid=$!
    
    # Save PID
    echo $server_pid > "$PID_FILE"
    log_message "INFO" "Server started with PID: $server_pid"
    
    # Wait for server to be ready
    local max_attempts=30
    local attempt=0
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}â³ Waiting for server to be ready...${NC}"
    while [ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]; do
        if curl -s "$HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            log_message "INFO" "Server is ready and responding"
            echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Server is ready${NC}"
            return 0
        fi
        
        # Show progress
        if [ $((attempt % 5)) -eq 0 ]; then
            echo -n "."
        fi
        
        attempt=$((attempt + 1))
        sleep 1
    done
    
    echo ""
    log_message "ERROR" "Server failed to start within $max_attempts seconds"
    echo -e "${RED}âŒ Server startup timeout${NC}"
    return 1
}

# Function to get server health info
get_server_health() {
    if check_server_running && curl -s "$HEALTH_ENDPOINT" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        local health_data=$(curl -s "$HEALTH_ENDPOINT" 2>/dev/null)
        echo "$health_data"
        return 0
    else
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to display server information
display_server_info() {
    echo ""
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… MCP Server Started Successfully${NC}"
    echo "========================================"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Server Type:${NC} $SERVER_TYPE"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Server Script:${NC} $SERVER_SCRIPT"
    echo -e "${CYAN}PID:${NC} $(cat "$PID_FILE")"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Port:${NC} $SERVER_PORT"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Health Check:${NC} $HEALTH_ENDPOINT"
    echo -e "${CYAN}Log File:${NC} $MCP_LOG_FILE"
    echo ""
    
    # Display server health details
    local health_info=$(get_server_health)
    if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
        echo -e "${CYAN}ğŸ¥ Server Health Details:${NC}"
        echo "$health_info" | jq '.' 2>/dev/null || echo "$health_info"
        echo ""
    fi
    
    # Display Qdrant dependency status
    display_qdrant_dependency_status
    echo ""
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}ğŸ“‹ Useful Commands:${NC}"
    echo -e "  Check MCP health: ${BLUE}curl $HEALTH_ENDPOINT${NC}"
    echo -e "  Test generation: ${BLUE}curl -X POST $HEALTH_ENDPOINT/generate -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{\"prompt\": \"Hello\"}'${NC}"
    echo -e "  View logs: ${BLUE}tail -f $MCP_LOG_FILE${NC}"
    echo -e "  Stop server: ${BLUE}./stop_mcp_only.sh${NC}"
    echo ""
    
    echo -e "${PURPLE}ğŸ”§ Qdrant Management:${NC}"
    echo -e "  Start Qdrant: ${BLUE}./start_qdrant.sh${NC}"
    echo -e "  Stop Qdrant: ${BLUE}./stop_qdrant.sh${NC}"
    echo -e "  Check Qdrant: ${BLUE}curl $QDRANT_HEALTH_ENDPOINT${NC}"
    echo ""
}

# Function to display usage
display_usage() {
    echo "Usage: $0 [SERVER_TYPE]"
    echo ""
    echo "Server Types:"
    echo "  simple     - Simple MCP server with basic features"
    echo "  high       - High-performance MCP server with GPU acceleration"
    echo "  unified    - Unified MCP server with all features (default)"
    echo ""
    echo "Examples:"
    echo "  $0              # Start unified server"
    echo "  $0 simple       # Start simple server"
    echo "  $0 high         # Start high-performance server"
    echo ""
    echo "Notes:"
    echo "  - This script only starts the MCP server"
    echo "  - For Qdrant management, use ./start_qdrant.sh and ./stop_qdrant.sh"
    echo "  - MCP will check for Qdrant dependency and inform if not available"
}

# Function to pre-flight checks
pre_flight_checks() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ” Pre-flight Checks${NC}"
    echo "===================="
    
    # Check if already running
    if check_server_running; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  MCP server is already running${NC}"
        echo -e "${CYAN}PID:${NC} $(cat "$PID_FILE")"
        echo -e "${CYAN}To stop:${NC} ./stop_mcp_only.sh"
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Check port availability
    if ! check_port_available; then
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Check dependencies
    activate_venv
    check_dependencies
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Pre-flight checks passed${NC}"
    echo ""
}

# Main execution
main() {
    # Check for help
    if [ "$1" = "-h" ] || [ "$1" = "--help" ]; then
        display_usage
        exit 0
    fi
    
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸš€ Starting MCP Server${NC}"
    echo "======================="
    
    # Setup logging
    setup_logging
    
    # Pre-flight checks
    pre_flight_checks
    
    # Determine server script
    determine_server_script
    
    # Check Qdrant dependency
    echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ” Checking Qdrant Dependency${NC}"
    echo "==============================="
    local qdrant_available=$(display_qdrant_dependency_status)
    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
        echo ""
        echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Qdrant is not available${NC}"
        echo -e "${CYAN}Continue anyway?${NC} MCP will use in-memory storage. [y/N]"
        read -r -t 10 response
        if [[ ! "$response" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
            echo -e "${BLUE}Starting Qdrant first...${NC}"
            if [ -f "./start_qdrant.sh" ]; then
                echo -e "${CYAN}You can start Qdrant with:${NC} ./start_qdrant.sh"
                echo -e "${CYAN}Then start MCP with:${NC} $0 $SERVER_TYPE"
                exit 0
            else
                echo -e "${RED}âŒ Qdrant start script not found${NC}"
                exit 1
            fi
        fi
    fi
    echo ""
    
    # Start server
    if start_server; then
        display_server_info
    else
        echo -e "${RED}âŒ Failed to start MCP server${NC}"
        echo -e "${CYAN}Check logs:${NC} tail -f $MCP_LOG_FILE"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Run main function
main "$@"
